{"step_by_step_thinking": "The class II cavity for inlay is a type of dental restoration. The cavosurface margin of the gingival seat is the edge where the cavity preparation meets the unprepared tooth surface. This margin should clear the adjacent tooth by a certain distance to prevent damage or interference with the adjacent tooth. The standard clearance is 0.5mm with a tolerance of 0.2mm.", "answer_choice": "B"}
